implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main UI component that manages the state and orchestrates all task operations (add, edit, delete, mark as completed/pending) by calling API methods and rendering TaskForm and TaskItem components.
implementation.name: App
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount:
    Call loadTasks to fetch all tasks from backend
On '+ Add Task' click:
    Open TaskForm for new task
On TaskForm submit:
    If editingTask is null:
        Call handleCreateTask (calls api.createTask)
    Else:
        Call handleUpdateTask (calls api.updateTask)
On delete button:
    Call handleDeleteTask (calls api.deleteTask)
On complete/pending toggle:
    Call handleToggleComplete (calls api.updateTask with toggled completed)
Render:
    TaskForm (for add/edit)
    List of TaskItem components for each task

missing_implementations: A new task must include a tag (the UI uses 'category' as tag, but it is not required and can be empty; the backend does not enforce presence of tag/category).

implementation.name: App
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main React component orchestrating event (task) management: triggers add, edit, delete, and update actions, and renders the form and list UI.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount, load all events (tasks)
When user clicks '+ Add Task', open TaskForm for new event
When user clicks 'Edit', open TaskForm with event data
On TaskForm submit, call createTask or updateTask
On delete, call deleteTask
On complete/incomplete, call updateTask
Render TaskForm and TaskItem for each event

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Form UI for adding or editing events (tasks); collects name (title), description, and other fields, then submits to parent handler.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display form fields: title (required), description, priority, category, due date
On submit:
    Validate title is present
    Call onSubmit with form data
On cancel:
    Call onCancel

implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays each event (task) with name, description, and controls for edit, delete, and mark complete/incomplete.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Render event (task) details: title, description, priority, category, due date
Show buttons: Edit, Delete, Done/Undo
On Edit: call onEdit
On Delete: confirm and call onDelete
On Done/Undo: call onToggleComplete

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint for adding a new event (task); receives event data and calls database to persist.
implementation.pseudo_code:
POST /tasks
Receive event data (TaskCreate)
Call database.add_task with event data
Return created event

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint for editing an existing event (task); receives updated data and calls database to persist changes.
implementation.pseudo_code:
PUT /tasks/{task_id}
Receive updated event data (TaskCreate)
Call database.update_task with event id and data
If not found, return 404
Return updated event

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint for deleting an event (task); removes event from database.
implementation.pseudo_code:
DELETE /tasks/{task_id}
Call database.delete_task with event id
If not found, return 404
Return success message

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Persists a new event (task) to storage; called by create_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all events
Create new event with unique id and provided data
Append to event list
Save all events
Return new event

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing event (task) in storage; called by update_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all events
Find event by id
Replace with updated data
Save all events
Return updated event or None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Removes an event (task) from storage; called by delete_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all events
Remove event with matching id
Save all events
Return True if deleted, False otherwise

missing_implementations: Require location when creating a new event
Multiple tasks can be assigned to a single event.
